column4: Hi i need Urgent help, i was updating to Lucid via do-release-upgrade via ssh and my internet connection died. i was at configuring sysctl.conf part of installation. what can i do? :(
my connection just got up and i can ssh into my box again
i just get a "no new release found"
what do you want the access for
like do you want to copy some content from win7 to lucid'
sorry man that was not for you :)
you can do the same by just sudo apt-get dist upgrade
E: Could not get lock /var/lib/dpkg/lock - open (11: Resource temporarily unavailable)
old ssh sesion is still active  "/usr/bin/python /tmp/tmp2MrIAm/lucid --mode=server --frontend=DistUpgradeViewText"
aptget: no process found can i jump into the other root session
have you typed sudo before apt-get dist upgrade
yes, but im logged in as root so no need. and its dist-upgrade
are you on a desktop or are you connected remotely to a server
ahh its dead now. have to go home check up on it now. buy
